roleset.name: To appoint, ordain to a clerical post

example.name: Passive with arg2
example.text: In 1234, [he]-1 was consecrated *-1 Archbishop of Canterbury.

example.name: Similar passive
example.text: [Four priests of the Catholic Church]-1 will be consecrated *-1 as bishops.

roleset.note: Roleset based on parallel additions to VN, PB, and sense groupings. VerbNet class dub-29.3-1. Framed by Claire.

roleset.name: Give, devote to a cause

role.descr: Sacrificer, person giving to a cause

example.name: all arguments
example.text: We could not consecrate our sinful lives to God.

example.name: With secondary predication
example.text: [They]-1 seek to be PRO-1 specially consecrated *-1 to Christ as his servants.

roleset.note: Roleset based on parallel additions to VN, PB, and sense groupings. No relevant VN entry. Framed by Claire.

roleset.name: dedicate to a deity, render holy

example.name: Passive
example.text: [The church]-1 was solemnly consecrated *-1 by the Bishop of Clifton.

example.name: With purpose
example.text: In 1817, [the churchyard]-1 was consecrated *-1 for burials.

roleset.note: Roleset based on parallel additions to VN, PB, and sense groupings. No appropriate VN class found. Framed by Claire.
